structural_fidelity.justification: The benchmark retains the exact code structure and logic of the original implementation with only minor modifications.

targeted_isolation.justification: The benchmark solely targets the parser component without including unrelated code, maintaining focused scope.

side_effect_preservation.justification: The benchmark preserves side effects as it performs the same computation without introducing unused or artificial constructs.

correctness_and_equivalence.justification: The benchmark accurately reproduces the original functionality of URL parsing, resulting in the same outputs under equivalent conditions.

computational_realism.justification: The benchmark realistically represents actual workloads as it uses a regex call, typical for parsing real-world URL formats.

context_neutrality.justification: Nomenclature and code structure are neutral, refraining from providing hints or biases towards optimization efforts or design choices.
